title: Spec: Refactor to generic document storage independent of speaker structure
description:
Design a generic JSON data structure for storing embeddings that is agnostic to the current speaker/agenda domain. The system should work with any document type without hardcoded knowledge of speaker fields (name, bio, abstract, etc.).

Goals:
1. Define generic document model (id, content, metadata, embeddings)
2. Separate domain-specific logic from core RAG functionality
3. Support arbitrary document types and schemas
4. Maintain backwards compatibility or provide migration path
5. Consider how this relates to the metadata storage design (chatboti-in9)

Deliverable: Specification document outlining:
- Current coupling to speaker structure
- Proposed generic document model
- API/interface changes needed
- Migration strategy from current speaker-centric data
- Integration with metadata storage design

title: Refactor: Move embeddings generation to CLI command instead of constructor
description:
Move embedding generation out of the constructor to a separate CLI command. This will:
1. Improve startup time by not generating embeddings on every initialization
2. Allow users to explicitly generate/update embeddings when needed
3. Separate concerns between initialization and embedding computation
close_reason: Refactored embeddings generation to separate CLI command

title: Spec: Merge embedding storage analysis into generic document storage spec
description:
Integrate the insights from embedding-storage-architecture.md and faiss-vs-numpy-size-comparison.md into docs/generic-document-storage-spec.md.

Goals:
1. Update Section 3 (Proposed Architecture) to recommend FAISS as primary vector storage
2. Add Section 2.5 (Storage Format Comparison) with analysis from embedding-storage-architecture.md
3. Update Section 5 (Integration Points) to include FAISS sizing data
4. Add performance benchmarks and memory comparisons
5. Update API examples to show FAISS usage
6. Keep all existing good content from the original spec
7. Remove/consolidate redundant sections

Key points to integrate:
- FAISS is smaller than NumPy (+15 MB vs +300 MB for ChromaDB)
- FAISS as primary vector storage (not Parquet/SQLite BLOB)
- Never use List[float] anywhere
- Always use ndarray[float32]
- Memory efficiency: 8x better than Python lists
- Performance: 10-100x faster with FAISS indexing
- Architecture: FAISS for vectors + SQLite for metadata

Deliverable:
- Single comprehensive spec: docs/generic-document-storage-spec.md (updated)
- Archive old analysis docs or delete them after merging
close_reason: Merged all embedding storage analysis into comprehensive generic document storage spec. Added FAISS recommendation, storage format comparison, package size analysis, and updated architecture throughout.

title: Refactor: Convert List[float] to np.ndarray[float32] throughout codebase
description:
Refactor all Python code to use NumPy float32 arrays instead of List[float] for embeddings and vector operations.

Goals:
1. Find all usages of List[float] in type hints and code
2. Replace with np.ndarray (dtype=float32)
3. Update function signatures and type hints
4. Ensure all embedding operations use NumPy arrays
5. Update serialization/deserialization to use .npy or binary formats
6. Maintain backwards compatibility where needed

Benefits:
- 4-6x memory reduction (see memory-efficiency-analysis.md)
- 100x faster vector operations with NumPy SIMD
- Cache-friendly contiguous memory layout
- Better integration with FAISS (uses float32 internally)

Files likely affected:
- chatboti/rag.py (embedding storage and operations)
- Any utility functions handling embeddings
- Serialization/deserialization code

Testing:
- Verify cosine distance calculations produce same results
- Check memory usage before/after
- Ensure serialization works correctly
close_reason: Completed refactoring to np.ndarray[float32] with full backwards compatibility and testing
